title: ISic020450. ISic020450
body:
Facsimile Images

[--- ἀνφο]τέροισι θεοῖ[σι]
[---]λκ̣α̣[.]

Apparatus criticus

Text after Arena 1989 (IGASM I) ; Guarducci (1967): [h]ε̄́ρο̄ισι θεοῖ[ς ; Gallavotti: [hυπερ]τ̣έροισι or [hυψι]τ̣έροισι or [ἀνφο]τ̣έροισι θεοῖ̣[σι] or [h]ιεροῖσι (θεο̄ν)
2: Manni Piraino: --]γυ̣[-- ; Johnston (1975): [ἀνέθ]ε̣κ̣ε̣ ; Gallavotti: [hυ]β̣λα̣[ῖος

English translation

[---] in honour of/to both gods [---]

Italian translation

[---] in onore di/a entrambi gli dei [---]

commentary

From the meagre fragments of the epigraph, Gallavotti hypothesises that it may be a dedication to the Dioscuri (on whose cult in Megara Iblea see Pareti 1920). Manni Piraino ascribes the alphabetical features to the Argolis area and Arena suggests, based on a hypothetical reconstruction of the second part of the text as ἀντ’ἀλκᾶς (therefore in Doric dialect), that the inscription can be ascribed to western Argolis. If the hypothesis of reconstruction as ἀλκά ('valiant, courageous', a rare word used in poetry, cf. e.g. h.Hom.28.3, Pi.O.9.72) were correct, one might think, especially given the dactylic incipit of the first part of the text, that it is a poetic text.

bibliography

    Arena 1989 78, fig. 14 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000638 26.1097 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796 Gallavotti 1975-1976 89ff. https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001974 Johnston 1975 153 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002504 Manni Piraino 1975 139, pl. 29.2 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001772 Guarducci 1967 313ff., fig. 151a-b https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000193 Guarducci 1964-1965 474, pl. 28.10 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001927
